intro: Alpinia biakensis, commonly known as the Biak ginger, is a tropical plant native to the Indonesian island of Biak. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important spices like ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender rhizomes and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its unique genetic makeup and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical research.
